events.title: Fundraiser for 'Australian hero' who disarmed terrorist during Bondi Beach mass shooting surpasses $2.6M
events.description: Australian hero who tackled Bondi Beach gunman receives $2.6M in donations in response to brave actions during deadly attack that left him wounded but praised globally.

events.title: Jeju Air crash: South Korea sets up independent inquiry into disaster that killed 179 amid delays and acrimony
events.description: MPs vote to investigate crash amid accusations from victims’ relatives of cover-ups and delays South Korea’s parliament has launched an independent inquiry into the deadliest air disaster on its soil amid accusations of investigation delays and cover-ups of last year’s Jeju Air crash. On 29 December 2024 all but two of the 181 people onboard a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 died when it crashed at Muan international airport, 288km south of Seoul, after reporting a bird strike during landing. Continue reading...

events.title: At least four people killed in mass stabbing in Taipei
events.description: Man, 27, from northern Taiwan reported to have fallen to his death in police chase after rampage through capital At least four people have died in a rare mass stabbing incident in central Taipei after an attacker used smoke grenades to cause chaos as he went on a violent rampage through Taiwan’s capital. Several people were also injured. The suspected assailant is among the dead after he fell from a building during a police chase through a busy shopping district on Friday evening. Continue reading...

events.title: Gunmen kill nine in Johannesburg township in South Africa’s second mass shooting this month
events.description: Attackers wound 10 others in Bekkersdal after opening fire at people in a bar and ‘randomly’ shooting in the street, police say Nine people have been killed after gunmen opened fire at a bar near Johannesburg in the second mass shooting in South Africa this month. Ten more were wounded in the early morning attack at the tavern in the impoverished Bekkersdal township in a gold mining area about 25 miles (40km) south-west of Johannesburg. Continue reading...

events.title: Australian state weighs ban on 'globalize the intifada' chants, masked protesters in wake of Hanukkah attack
events.description: Australia's New South Wales is proposing a ban on "globalize the intifada" chants after 15 people were killed in the ISIS-inspired Bondi Beach Hanukkah shooting.

events.title: Former Australian minister says ‘radical Islam pulled the trigger’ in nation's worst terror attack
events.description: Josh Frydenberg slams Anthony Albanese's government over rising antisemitic violence in Australia, warning years of inaction enabled extremism to flourish.

events.title: Japan to restart world's largest nuclear power plant
events.description: After the Fukushima disaster in 2011, Japan shut down all its nuclear reactors. The planned restart of a reactor at Kashiwazaki-Kariwa plant has triggered protests in the coastal city of Niigata.

events.title: World News in Brief: More UN staff detentions in Yemen, peacekeepers killed in Sudan sent home, attacks in Ukraine
events.description: The UN Secretary-General on Friday condemned the arbitrary detention of 10 more UN personnel by Houthi de facto authorities in Yemen, warning that the growing crackdown is crippling humanitarian operations and putting millions of lives at risk.

events.title: Australia terror attack exposes ISIS resurgence as experts warn of global jihadist networks
events.description: Terror attack in Australia exposes growing jihadist networks as security experts warn ISIS remains far from defeated despite recent government claims.

events.title: Wanting action after the Bondi attack is understandable - but kneejerk responses that curtail freedoms have their own perils
events.description: Proposed changes to gun laws and protest rights in NSW need to be approached with forensic clarity – taking a pause might be wiser Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast It is understandable that the Minns Labor government wants to rush new restrictions about guns and protests into law. A tragedy like the Bondi massacre demands action – and the unpredictable political wave of public feeling after a disaster can either wipe you out or see you riding high. The risks are obvious in Anthony Albanese’s plummeting poll numbers. Continue reading...

events.title: Japan preparing to restart the world's largest nuclear power plant
events.description: A local government in Japan voted Monday to restart the world's largest nuclear power plant, which has been closed since 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster.

events.title: World News in Brief: UN to evacuate Kadugli base in Sudan, celebrating migrant contributions, ending colonialism
events.description: The United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) will evacuate its logistics base in Kadugli, Sudan, in the wake of the “heinous attack” this past weekend that killed six Bangladeshi peacekeepers and seriously injured eight others.

events.title: ISIS, Iran escalating global campaign against Jews, Israel spy chief says
events.description: Mossad Director David Barnea said Israel will pursue the Bondi attackers and those who sent them, warning Iran and ISIS are accelerating global plots against Jews.

events.title: Sudan war: World urged not to ignore ‘gruesome sexual violence’
events.description: Harrowing new details emerged on Thursday in a UN report detailing targeted sexual violence and summary executions in Sudan’s North Darfur region, attributed to paramilitary fighters who overran the city of El Fasher in late October.

events.title: ‘Dan taught me to live for every moment’: French Bondi shooting victim, 27, honoured at Sydney memorial
events.description: Rabbi calls for good deeds in memory of Dan Elkayam and other victims of attack at Jewish event ‘Left an immeasurable void’: Holocaust survivors, community heroes and ‘spirited child’ among victims of Bondi terror attack Like many friendships, Jesse Singer and Dan Elkayam’s had its own rituals. “Whenever it was a sunny day, we’d message each other throughout the day to see if we could finish work as early as possible and get down to the beach to play football.” Continue reading...

events.title: Russian general killed by car bomb, third senior military leader killed this year
events.description: Russian Lt. General Fanil Sarvarov killed in Moscow car bombing as investigators suspect Ukrainian intelligence involvement in the deadly attack on Monday.

events.title: Australia news live: Bowen decries Coalition’s ‘disgusting’ partisan ‘pile-on’ after Bondi attack; ABC defends Tingle and Ferguson over coverage
events.description: NSW Liberals voted with Labor to pass anti-protest and gun reform legislation last night, while the Nationals opposed the bill. Follow live updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Shareholders have overwhelmingly thrown their support behind a deal to create an Australian media giant spanning television, radio, print and digital, Australian Associated Press reports. Shareholders in the company that owns Seven Network and the West Australian yesterday approved its merger with the group that owns Triple M and the Hit Network radio stations. The combination of these two great companies will bring together the best content creators in the country and deliver significant financial and strategic benefits. This is an opportunity to create a national, diversified media organisation with extensive scale and reach across free-to-air television, streaming, audio and digital publishing assets. There will be a public version of the report. I mean, there will be elements of it which necessarily deal with classified information and it’s, by definition, important that remains classified. But we’ve made clear there’ll be transparency in respect of this. Dennis Richardson is a person with enormous experience, first-hand experience, in terms of being secretaries of departments, but also these intelligence agencies. Continue reading...

events.title: At least three killed in Israeli attack on southern Lebanon’s Sidon
events.description: Deadly Israeli air strike is latest in Israel's near-daily violations of 2024 ceasefire agreement with Hezbollah.

events.title: Russian general killed in Moscow car bombing
events.description: With senior Russian general Fanil Sarvarov dying in a Moscow car blast, Russia's federal investigators are looking into possible involvement of Ukrainian intelligence services.

events.title: UN urges calm in Bangladesh after killing of protest leader sparks unrest
events.description: The United Nations has urged calm in Bangladesh after the killing of a prominent youth protest leader sparked fresh unrest, raising concerns about political violence and the safety of civic space as the country prepares for elections early next year.

events.title: Civilians at risk amid escalating Thailand-Cambodia conflict: UN rights chief
events.description: Intensifying air strikes and heavy artillery fire across Thailand and Cambodia have left civilians increasingly at risk, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk warned on Thursday.

events.title: Charlie Kirk's alleged assassin Tyler Robinson tries to boot prosecutors from case
events.description: New court filing reveals prosecutor's family member was at Charlie Kirk shooting, allegedly creating conflict in death penalty case against Tyler Robinson.

events.title: Illinois officers crawl under burning car to save trapped driver in dramatic Interstate 88 rescue
events.description: Heroic officers in Illinois risked their lives to save a motorist trapped beneath a flaming car following a dramatic crash on Interstate 88 early Sunday morning.

events.title: Fisherman survives near-fatal shark attack with own lifesaving care, instincts that kept him alive
events.description: Hawaii fisherman survives brutal shark attack after trying to help tangled predator, performs lifesaving first aid on himself in dramatic ocean rescue.

events.title: Australian PM Albanese gets booed during Bondi Beach vigil honoring Hanukkah attack victims
events.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese faced boos at a vigil for Bondi Beach shooting victims Sunday, as some 10,000 mourners gathered to honor those killed.

events.title: Former Hamas hostage warned Australian leaders about dangers of antisemitism months before Bondi Beach attack
events.description: Former Hamas hostage Eli Sharabi had warned Australian leaders about rising antisemitism months before the deadly Bondi Beach Hanukkah shooting attack.

events.title: Sweden and Germany slash aid budgets to focus on Ukraine and defence spending
events.description: Echoing the dismantling of USAID, other countries are changing funding priorities and health and hunger programmes in Africa will lose out The notion of humanitarian aid being used to combat poverty and hunger is being replaced in Europe with geopolitical “games” as states redirect aid to Ukraine and to defence spending, analysts warn after recent announcements by Sweden and Germany. Earlier this year, humanitarian groups called for European donors to fill the gap as President Donald Trump dismantled the USAID programme, but instead other nations are further pulling back from their commitments around the world. Continue reading...

events.title: Aid agencies warn Gaza response at breaking point as Israel urged to lift new restrictions
events.description: Humanitarian agencies working in the Occupied Palestinian Territory (OPT) have warned that life-saving aid operations risk collapse unless Israel immediately lifts new barriers that are blocking access and forcing international charities to shut down.

events.title: Russian general killed by car bomb in Moscow, officials say
events.description: Lt Gen Fanil Sarvarov is the third military official to have been killed in bomb attacks in the Russian capital over the last year.

events.title: Car bomb in Moscow kills Russia's Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov
events.description: A car bomb killed a senior Russian general in southern Moscow on Monday morning as officials reported "slow progress" in talks with the United States on how to end the war in Ukraine. Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov, 56, head of the Russian General Staff's training department, was killed when the bomb, which had been placed under his parked car and detonated in a residential quarter of southern Moscow. Story by Camille Knight.

events.title: 'Extremely cunning' suspect in deadly Taiwan knife attack planned it for over a year
events.description: Police say the suspect in a deadly knife and grenade attack that left three dead and 11 wounded in Taiwan’s capital had been meticulously planning the assault for more than a year

events.title: Freed Nigerian schoolchildren to be reunited with families
events.description: Month-long ordeal ends but no details released on how they regained their freedom or who was behind abduction A final group of 130 kidnapped Nigerian schoolchildren freed by the government on Sunday are expected to be reunited with their families in the central Niger state on Monday, ending a month-long ordeal that drew global concern. Last month, unknown gunmen took hundreds of schoolchildren and 12 teachers from St Mary’s Catholic school, Papiri community in Niger state, which runs west from the capital, Abuja, to neighbouring Benin. Continue reading...

events.title: US Coast Guard pursuing another oil tanker off coast of Venezuela
events.description: Official indicates vessel is subject to sanctions after Trump’s ‘blockade’ on sanctioned tankers in and out of Venezuela US Coast Guard officials said on Sunday they were tracking an oil tanker in international waters close to Venezuela , multiple unnamed US officials have told US media, marking the second such action over the weekend – and the third within the past week. What officials described as an “active pursuit” in the Caribbean Sea took place a day after the coast guard seized another vessel off the coast of Venezuela, as Washington ramps up its pressure campaign targeting the South American country’s vital oil sector. Continue reading...

events.title: Bondi Beach shooting suspect trained with father before attack, police say
events.description: A man suspected of killing 15 people during a shooting in Bondi Beach "conducted firearms training" with his father before the attack on a Jewish event, Australian police have said.

events.title: Syria’s humanitarian needs remain high despite reduced violence, UN warns
events.description: Humanitarian needs in Syria remain immense despite a year of reduced violence and political change, with millions still displaced, basic services strained and funding shortfalls threatening aid operations, senior UN officials said on Thursday.

events.title: ‘Israel is only the appetizer’: Huckabee warns Iran threat looms as Netanyahu eyes Trump talks
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seeks meeting with President Donald Trump as officials warn Iranian missile drills could cover surprise attack plans.

events.title: On Maduro’s ‘terror island,’ Hezbollah operatives move in as tourists drift out
events.description: Israel's strikes on Hezbollah are driving the terror group to expand operations in Venezuela, creating new security threats closer to U.S. borders.

events.title: Weather tracker: Further flood watches issued across California
events.description: Heavy rain and mountain snow forecast for northern and central parts, with river and flooding likely in Los Angeles After prolonged heavy rainfall and devastating flooding across the Pacific north-west in the past few weeks, further flood watches have been issued across California through this week. With 50-75mm (2-3in) of rainfall already reported across northern California this weekend, a series of atmospheric rivers will continue to bring periods of heavy rain and mountain snow across the northern and central parts of the state, with flood watches extending until Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Syria: At least 2 killed in Aleppo clashes between army and SDF
events.description: The Syrian army and the Kurdish-led SDF traded the blame over the reason for the attacks in Aleppo. Turkey blames Kurdish forces for not wanting to integrate into Syria's newly-established army.

events.title: Freed Nigerian schoolchildren handed over to government
events.description: In tonight's edition, the final group of 130 kidnapped schoolchildren in Nigeria have been handed over and received by authorities, ending a month-long ordeal that drew global concern. Also, a poor rainy season this year has deepened drought fears in the eastern Horn of Africa, with severe consequences for food security in early 2026. And the fourth edition of Kivu Fashion Week brought some colour to a region long marred by conflict.

events.title: Israeli diaspora minister says Australia should have seen 'writing on the wall' before terror attack
events.description: Israel’s Amichai Chikli said Australian officials overlooked rising antisemitism and extremist rhetoric ahead of the Bondi Beach Hanukkah attack, criticizing the focus on gun laws.

events.title: A radio station in Amsterdam is a lifeline for Sudan. After USAID cuts, it's faltering
events.description: Budget cuts threaten the future of Amsterdam-based Radio Dabanga, which has served as an information lifeline for Sudanese people about their war-torn country.

events.title: Calming the mind and promoting global peace on World Meditation Day
events.description: Meditation, which has its roots in religious, yogic and secular traditions from various civilisations, calls for living in the present moment.

events.title: Wildfire-hit town wins €468m in Spain's Christmas lottery
events.description: The town of La Bañeza, which has a population of around 11,000, was badly affected by wildfires in the summer.

events.title: India's nuclear sector to expand, draw foreign capital
events.description: Nuclear reform opens India's nuclear sector to foreign firms, but critics highlight safety and supply chain gaps.

events.title: Russia escalates attacks on key Ukrainian region of Odesa
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky warned the attacks were an attempt by Moscow to block Ukraine's access to maritime logistics.

events.title: Bondi gunmen 'meticulously' planned attack for months, police allege
events.description: Police release a tranche of documents allegedly tracing the suspects' movements prior to the deadly shooting.

events.title: Australians honor victims one week after Bondi Beach shooting
events.description: A week after a deadly mass shooting, Australia marks an official day of reflection to honor the 15 people killed by gunmen.

events.title: Moscow car blast kills Russian general, investigators suspect Ukraine involvement
events.description: A senior Russian general was killed Monday morning after an explosive device detonated underneath his car in southern Moscow. According to investigators, the attack on Lt. Gen. Fanil Sarvarov, who led the Operational Training Directorate of the Russian Armed Forces General Staff, may have been "linked" to "Ukrainian special forces”.

events.title: Car bomb kills Russian general in Moscow
events.description: A Russian general was killed after an explosive device detonated underneath his car in Moscow on Monday. Investigators said Ukraine could be behind the attack, the third such killing of a senior military officer in a year.

events.title: Sudan war: Kordofan’s El-Obeid ‘one or two steps’ away from being attacked
events.description: As fighting escalates in Sudan, “people are scared, people are fleeing their homes”, the UN migration agency, IOM, said on Friday, noting that more than 50,000 people have been uprooted since late October in the Kordofans region alone.

events.title: Manhunt underway for suspect accused of killing two people outside Chipotle restaurant
events.description: Davinci Leonard manhunt: U.S. Marshals offer $7,500 reward for suspect accused of killing two people in March shooting outside Brockton, Massachusetts Chipotle.

events.title: Swimmer vanishes after possible shark encounter off California coast during group outing
events.description: New details emerged as swimmer went missing off California coast in possible shark attack. Witness saw shark breach with human body at Lovers Point Beach.

events.title: Convicted killer kept in police oversight role as city council dismisses concerns over public safety
events.description: Salem City Council sparks controversy with 5-4 vote to reappoint convicted killer Kyle Hedquist to police oversight board despite law enforcement warnings.

events.title: Former classmate says suspect in Brown, MIT killings was ‘socially awkward’ and ‘angry’ during college years
events.description: Shocking details emerge about suspect in Brown University shooting and MIT professor killing as former friend speaks about troubling behavior.

events.title: NGOs fear Israel registration rules risk collapse of Gaza aid operations
events.description: International organisations not registered by 31 December face closure in Israel, but the Israeli government says aid delivery will not be affected.

events.title: How Israel's grassroots hostage families group became a powerful international force
events.description: With just one hostage left in Gaza, members of the forum reflect on its influence in Israel and abroad.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Balancing expectations and pressure: Morocco wins in tense AFCON opening game
events.description: Ayoub El Kaabi's spectacular bicycle kick gernered royal approval as Morocco opened the 35th Africa Cup of Nations with a 2-0 victory over Comoros on Sunday. Home fans, including Moroccan Crown Prince Moulay Hassan, who greeted the players before kickoff, witnessed a tense match as Comoros, ranked 108th in the world, put up a determined fight against one of the tournament favorites. Details and analysis with Maher Mezahi, football journalist and contributing editor to "Africa is a country".

events.title: Israel kills two Palestinians in Gaza City as ceasefire violations mount
events.description: Deadly attack comes as Gaza government media office says Israel violated ceasefire 875 times since it began in October.

events.title: Saudi Arabia awards Pakistan's powerful army chief highest national honor after defense pact
events.description: Pakistan's military says Saudi Arabia has awarded its highest national honor to Pakistan’s powerful army chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir, during his visit to Riyadh, underscoring deepening ties between the two countries, including cooperation on defens...

events.title: Cyberattack disrupts France's postal service and banking during Christmas rush
events.description: A suspected cyberattack has knocked France’s national postal service and its banking arm offline during the busy Christmas season

events.title: Mica Miller case: South Carolina pastor charged with allegedly cyberstalking wife for years before her death
events.description: South Carolina pastor John-Paul Miller faces new federal cyberstalking charges allegedly targeting his estranged wife before her April 2024 suicide.

events.title: China quietly loads 100+ ICBMs into new missile silos near Mongolia: report
events.description: China has reportedly loaded over 100 new intercontinental ballistic missiles into border silos, accelerating nuclear expansion faster than any other power.

events.title: Manhunt underway in South Africa after gunmen open fire at tavern, killing 9 and wounding 10
events.description: Manhunt underway after masked gunmen kill nine people at South African tavern in Bekkersdal township. At least 10 others hospitalized in the attack.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia to hold ceasefire talks, says foreign minister
events.description: At least 41 people have been killed and nearly one million others displaced on both sides, officials said.

events.title: Australian move to fast-track new gun and protest laws after Bondi shooting draws criticism
events.description: Civil liberties advocates say laws 'damage our democracy' while others say they scapegoat gun owners.

events.title: Sudan’s Darfur grapples with severe measles outbreak amid ongoing violence
events.description: MSF official tells Al Jazeera South Darfur hospital 'overwhelmed' by rapid increase in measles cases.

events.title: ‘A champion of Aboriginal rights’: Alice Springs leader Geoffrey Shaw dies aged 79
events.description: The 79-year-old Vietnam war veteran and founding member of the Central Land Council ‘believed deeply in service’ Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Warning: This article contains images of and references to Indigenous Australians who have died One of Central Australia’s most highly respected Aboriginal leaders and Vietnam war veteran has died. Kaytetye and Arrernte man Geoffrey Shaw OAM was born in the dry Todd riverbed in 1945 and began his military career at 18 in 1964, serving until the early 1970s before returning home to devote himself to his community in Alice Springs. Continue reading...

events.title: News outlet informing Sudanese about war faces foreign aid cuts
events.description: Budget cuts threaten the future of an Amsterdam-based journalism outlet informing people in Sudan about war, genocide, and how to survive.

events.title: ‘It was like being under house arrest’: Tanzania’s opposition fears mounting crackdown
events.description: Following the deadly protests that broke out during Tanzania’s October 29 elections, a new wave of demonstrations planned for Independence Day on December 9 was thwarted by a heavy police presence. Tanzanian opposition members and lawyers now fear a further escalation in the government's crackdown on dissent.

events.title: Cambodia says Thailand launched air strikes after ASEAN met on border clashes
events.description: Cambodia accused Thailand of airstrikes on its soil on Monday, hours after Thailand’s foreign minister announced plans for a bilateral meeting at an ASEAN gathering in Kuala Lumpur. Recent fighting has killed at least 23 and displaced more than 900,000 on both sides.

events.title: Ecuadorian soldiers jailed over disappearance of four murdered boys - whose deaths sparked protests
events.description: Eleven soldiers have been jailed for more than 34 years over the disappearance of four murdered boys in Ecuador.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia to resume ceasefire talks after deadly border clashes
events.description: Thailand’s foreign minister says Thailand and Cambodia will resume talks to work toward a more durable ceasefire along their border

events.title: Bondi Beach shooting suspect conducted firearms training with his father, police say
events.description: A man accused of killing 15 people at Sydney’s Bondi Beach allegedly conducted firearms training with his father

events.title: At UN, nations pledge people-first digital future, tighter AI safeguards
events.description: UN Member States on Wednesday pledged to narrow widening digital divides and put stronger safeguards around artificial intelligence (AI), as the General Assembly concluded a major review of how the world manages the Internet and fast-evolving digital technologies.

events.title: Man rushed to hospital in apparent self-inflicted shooting at Atlanta airport
events.description: Man suffers apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound at Atlanta's Hartsfield-Jackson Airport near baggage claim. Victim hospitalized, alert and conscious.

events.title: Several elephants killed in train crash after impact causes multiple coaches to derail
events.description: A high-speed passenger train struck an elephant herd in northeastern India, killing seven wild animals while all 650 passengers escape unharmed.

events.title: Élysée Palace staff member to stand trial over theft of precious tableware
events.description: Thomas M is accused of stealing solid silver and porcelain used for state banquets from France's presidential palace.

events.title: 130 Nigerian schoolchildren freed after mass abduction
events.description: A group of 130 Nigerian schoolchildren abducted last month were freed, ending a mass abduction that drew global concern.

events.title: Can diplomacy end the conflict between Thailand and Cambodia?
events.description: The neighbouring countries hold their first direct meeting in regional push for peace.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Man jailed for 1,335 years as El Salvador sentences almost 250 MS-13 gang members
events.description: Attorney general’s office also says 10 people received prison terms from 463 to 958 years amid crackdown on gangs under state of emergency El Salvador has announced prison sentences for hundreds of gang members, with some of the convicted receiving terms of hundreds of years. The attorney general’s office posted on X that 248 members of the notorious Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) street gang had received “exemplary sentences” for 43 homicides and 42 disappearances, among other crimes. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany news: Man drives car into bus stop in Giessen
events.description: According to the police, the man crashed into two other vehicles at an intersection before crashing into a bus stop in Giessen. Meanwhile, A plane carrying 141 Afghan nationals landed in the city of Hanover. DW has more.

events.title: Settlements, hotels and farms flooded in Kenya’s Rift Valley
events.description: Dickson Ngome's farm at Lake Naivasha in Kenya's Rift Valley has been submerged due to rising water levels

events.title: Fifty days on, Jamaica struggles to rebuild after Hurricane Melissa’s unprecedented destruction
events.description: Fifty days have passed since Hurricane Melissa ravaged Jamaica, leaving behind an unprecedented trail of destruction.

events.title: Bondi Beach suspects filmed antisemitic video manifesto, Australian investigators say
events.description: Father-son duo accused in Bondi Beach shooting allegedly created antisemitic manifesto with Islamic State ideology, Australian investigators reveal.

events.title: ‘Miracle’ of Zealandia: chick is born to rare takahē pair thought to be infertile
events.description: Unexpected arrival is a boon for birdlife in New Zealand, where there are only 500 takahē left A pair of rare native New Zealand takahē birds who were believed infertile have stunned staff at the world’s largest urban eco-sanctuary, after hatching a “miracle” chick. The roughly seven-week old chick was discovered inside Zealandia, a fully fenced eco-sanctuary 10 minutes from Wellington’s city centre, in November, but its arrival has been a closely guarded secret to ensure its safety. Continue reading...

events.title: French PM Lecornu races to pass special budget law to avoid shutdown
events.description: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu held talks on Monday with French political leaders on emergency legislation to keep the government running in the new year in the ​absence of a proper budget. A joint committee of lawmakers from both ‍chambers failed on Friday to hammer out a full 2026 budget bill, forcing Lecornu to seek stopgap legislation, a so called 'special law', ​to allow spending, tax collection and borrowing to continue in January. Details and analysis by FRANCE 24 reporter Clovis Casali.

events.title: Brown University custodian told security suspicious man was ‘casing’ building weeks before shooting: report
events.description: Derek Lisi told Boston Globe he saw Brown University shooting suspect "casing" engineering building about 10 times since early January.

events.title: Yale professor’s father charged in mother’s decades-old murder, says he ‘used me as bait’: report
events.description: Daughter reveals she feared father 'used me as bait' to lure mother to her death in 1982. Yale professor breaks silence on father's murder arrest.

events.title: Australia vows to strengthen hate speech laws, gun control in wake of Bondi Beach attack
events.description: Australia proposes new hate speech laws and gun buyback program after Bondi Beach attack, sparking a heated debate over the government's response.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Manchester Museum seeks help to uncover hidden histories of African collection
events.description: New Africa Hub confronts colonial-era silences by asking visitors to share insights on 40,000 objects It’s a rare thing for a museum to talk about what it doesn’t know. But unanswered questions and archival silences are at the heart of the new Africa Hub at Manchester Museum, north-west England, which is inviting people around the world to help fill the gaps. The museum holds more than 40,000 items from across Africa, many of which were traded, collected, looted or preserved during the era of the British empire. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Slightly haunted but manageable’: new signs cause confusion – and delight – in Christchurch
events.description: Six absurdist signs resembling official city council information boards have popped up across New Zealand’s second-largest city Outside an abandoned building in New Zealand’s second-biggest city, a sign reads “slightly haunted but manageable”. In the middle of a busy shopping strip, pedestrians are warned to keep to a 2.83km/h walking speed. In another part of Christchurch, one piece of signage declares simply “don’t”. The baffling boards are not an overzealous new council initiative, but a piece of art designed to “play with the way we take authority and signage so seriously”. Continue reading...

events.title: UK: 'Driving Home For Christmas' singer Chris Rea dies
events.description: The guitarist and songwriter Chris Rea passed away after a short illness, his family said. His Christmas song became an integral part of the holiday spirit around the world.

events.title: Indonesians set to face cement giant Holcim in Swiss court
events.description: The landmark climate case by four residents of Indonesia's Pari Island against one of the world's largest cement producers has cleared a major hurdle.

events.title: Syria and Kurdish-led SDF agree to de-escalate after deadly clashes in Aleppo
events.description: Syrian government forces and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) agreed to de-escalate fighting in the northern city of Aleppo late on Monday, after a wave of exchanges that both sides blamed on each other left at least two civilians dead and several others wounded.

events.title: AFCON host Morocco starts tournament with home victory
events.description: A spectacular bicycle kick earned royal approval for Ayoub El Kaabi as host Morocco opened the 35th Africa Cup of Nations with a 2-0 win over Comoros on Sunday. Morocco Crown Prince Moulay Hassan, who greeted the players before kickoff, and home fans had endured a frustrating game as island nation Comoros, ranked 108th in the world, stubbornly held out against one of the tournament favorites. Analysis by Keir Radnedge, author and sports commentator at the World Soccer magazine.

events.title: Car hits people waiting to watch a parade in a Dutch town, injuring 9
events.description: Police in the Netherlands say a car has driven into a crowd waiting to watch a parade in an eastern town and injured nine people

events.title: Gaza: Access to food improves but living conditions remain dire
events.description: A pregnant woman in Gaza thought she might lose her child because of malnourishment. Ten days ago, she gave birth and is now in recovery thanks to World Food Programme (WFP) facilities that are back up and running again, the agency’s representative for Palestine said on Thursday.

events.title: New Trump envoy says he will serve to make Greenland part of US
events.description: Denmark warns Washington to respect its sovereignty, while Greenland says it will decide its own future.

events.title: Baby followed by BBC back in Gaza hospital after treatment abroad
events.description: The BBC revisits one-year-old Siwar Ashour who was temporarily evacuated to Jordan for medical treatment during the Gaza war.

events.title: US and Ukraine call Miami talks productive despite no breakthrough
events.description: Donald Trump's special envoy, Steve Witkoff, issued a statement with the top Ukrainian negotiator after discussing the latest peace plans.

events.title: Rights groups condemn new record number of executions in Saudi Arabia
events.description: At least 347 people have now been put to death this year, according to the UK-based campaign group Reprieve.

events.title: Deadly clashes break out in Aleppo between Syrian army, Kurdish-led SDF
events.description: At least two people have been killed in clashes between government forces and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces.

events.title: Srebrenica: Genocide on Trial
events.description: The horrors of the Srebrenica genocide in Bosnia and Herzegovina and the war crimes trials that gave birth to the ICC.

events.title: Trump pauses more offshore wind projects citing national security concerns
events.description: The directive pausing five projects comes as the administration ramps up offshore oil and gas production.

events.title: Displacement camp running out of supplies for people fleeing Sudan’s war
events.description: Authorities say they don't have enough food, tents, and equipment to accommodate everyone fleeing Sudan’s war.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Peace talks to end the war in Ukraine continue in Florida
events.description: The latest on the negotiations to end Russia's war on Ukraine, as talks with representatives from Moscow, Kyiv and the Trump administration continue in Miami this week.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.description: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: Salah rescues Egypt with late winner as AFCON campaign begins
events.description: Mohamed Salah struck deep into stoppage time to spare Egypt an opening-day shock at the Africa Cup of Nations, sealing a hard-fought 2–1 win over Zimbabwe as the record champions made a winning start to their Group B campaign.

events.title: France races to pass stopgap budget law after talks for proper budget fail
events.description: France faces emergency stopgap legislation to avoid a government shutdown after lawmakers abandoned 2026 budget talks on Friday, failing to agree on a compromise ​bill. Members of a joint committee of lawmakers from both houses threw in the towel ‍after less than an hour of talks to agree a budget bill. Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu said he would consult with key political leaders ​on Monday on the next steps to be taken, adding there was no longer ​enough time for a parliamentary vote on a budget before the end of the year. Story by Bryan Quinn.

events.title: China hits French cheese with tariffs, broadening trade conflict
events.description: China ⁠will impose provisional duties of up to 42.7% on dairy products imported from the European Union, the latest in a series of measures against EU exports widely seen as retaliation for the bloc's electric vehicle tariffs.

events.title: Cyberattack disrupts France's postal service during Christmas rush
events.description: A Cyberattack has disrupted France’s postal service, La Poste, halting deliveries during the peak Christmas season. Customers of the company’s banking arm, La Banque Postale, were blocked from using the application to approve payments or conduct other banking services.

events.title: Australia marks Day of Reflection for Bondi Beach shooting victims
events.description: Australians are lighting candles Sunday to remember the victims of a mass shooting at a Jewish festival in Sydney's Bondi Beach

events.title: Élysée Palace silver steward arrested for stealing thousands of euros' worth of silverware
events.description: Three men are set to stand trial next year after a silver steward at the French president's residence was arrested for stealing silverware worth thousands of euros

events.title: Starlink in the crosshairs: How Russia could attack Elon Musk's conquering of space
events.description: NATO-nation intelligence services believe Russia is developing a weapon to target Starlink satellites

events.title: Crimean Tatar artist moulds new path through clay in wartime Ukraine
events.description: Through her ceramics, Crimean Tatar artist Elvira Demerdzhi finds moments of calm and a sense of home amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

events.title: Brown University hires former US Attorney Zachary Cunha as possible campus shooting lawsuits loom
events.description: Brown University has retained former U.S. Attorney Zachary Cunha to coordinate with authorities as it faces potential legal action following the Dec. 13 campus shooting.

events.title: Florida teens to be tried as adults in brutal killing of 14-year-old girl
events.description: Two Florida teens accused of luring a 14-year-old classmate into the woods before allegedly shooting and burning her will be tried as adults for first-degree premeditated murder charges.

events.title: US envoy Witkoff says high-level Miami talks focused on 'unified Gazan authority' as Israel ceasefire advances
events.description: The U.S. leads talks with Egypt, Qatar and Turkey on Gaza ceasefire Phase 2, focusing on unified governance and regional integration for long-term stability.

events.title: Outrage after CBS pulls 60 Minutes segment on El Salvador’s Cecot prison
events.description: Controversially appointed editor-in-chief Bari Weiss says: ‘I held that story and I held it because it wasn’t ready’ CBS News was dealing with internal and external uproar on Monday after it pulled at the last minute an investigation for its flagship 60 Minutes show into the harsh prison in El Salvador where the Trump administration deported hundreds of Venezuelans from the US earlier this year. The episode about the Cecot mega-prison was due to air on Sunday night. However, in an “editor’s note” posted on X late that afternoon, the broadcaster’s official account announced that “the lineup for tonight’s edition of 60 Minutes has been updated. Our report ‘Inside Cecot’ will air in a future broadcast.” Additional reporting by Jeremy Barr Continue reading...

events.title: Ecuador court sentences 11 air force troops over disappearance of four boys
events.description: Long sentences in case of Afro-Ecuadorian ‘Guayaquil Four’ focuses attention on president’s crackdown on crime A court in Ecuador has sentenced 11 air force personnel to decades in prison over the forced disappearance” of four Afro-Ecuadorian boys aged between 11 and 15 during security operations in the country’s largest city last year. The case of the “ Guayaquil Four ” is widely seen as the starkest example of human rights abuses under the iron-fist security policy pursued by the rightwing president, Daniel Noboa, who placed the armed forces at the centre of the fight against drug trafficking. Continue reading...

events.title: CBS News delays 60 Minutes segment on El Salvador’s Cecot mega-prison
events.description: Backlash after broadcaster announces investigation, due to air on Sunday night, ‘needs additional reporting’ CBS News is facing a backlash, including from one of its own correspondents, after it cancelled a 60 Minutes investigation into a brutal prison in El Salvador where the Trump administration has deported hundreds of migrants. The episode of its flagship program about the Cecot mega-prison was due to air on Sunday night. However, in an “editor’s note” posted on X , the broadcaster’s official account announced that “the lineup for tonight’s edition of 60 Minutes has been updated. Our report ‘Inside Cecot’ will air in a future broadcast.” Continue reading...

events.title: Russia says Ukraine peace talks 'proceeding constructively,' as Kremlin launches deadly strike on Odesa
events.description: Peace talks between Russia and Ukraine reportedly proceed "constructively" in Florida even as deadly missile strike hits Odesa, killing eight people.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Coast Guard pursues oil tanker Trump administration says evaded Venezuela blockade
events.description: The Trump administration continued its pressure campaign against Venezuela's president over the weekend, enforcing a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers traveling to and from the country.

events.title: Spectacular Christmas light show in 800-year-old cathedral in Brussels
events.description: Lights, music, and history came together in a show inside the Cathedral of Saint Michael and Saint Gudula in Belgium's capital, Brussels on Saturday to mark the building's 800th anniversary.

events.title: Security Council hears of fading election prospects in Libya
events.description: The path to long-awaited elections in Libya is paved with complications but they can be overcome, the UN Special Representative for the country said on Friday in a briefing to the Security Council.

events.title: Security Council renews DR Congo peacekeeping mission amid renewed M23 offensives in the east
events.description: The UN Security Council on Friday unanimously extended the mandate of the UN peacekeeping mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) for another year, as fighting in the country’s east intensified amid renewed offensives by the M23 rebel group.

events.title: US lawmakers threaten legal action against Attorney General over Epstein files
events.description: On Monday, Senator Schumer said he would introduce a resolution to take legal action over the failure to release the full files.

events.title: Foster scores late goal as South Africa defeat Angola in their AFCON opener
events.description: Lyle Foster's match-winning 79th-minute strike allowed South Africa to win first opening match at AFCON since 2004.

events.title: Ecuador soldiers sentenced to 34 years in prison for disappearing children
events.description: Sentencing caps yearlong investigation into abuse, disappearance of four children in Guayaquil amid crime crackdown.

events.title: Cambodia-Thailand fighting continues as ceasefire talks loom
events.description: Fighting between Cambodia and Thailand continues despite talks, with communities facing fear and economic anxiety.

events.title: China hits EU dairy industry with tariffs of up to 42.7%
events.description: Move made after first phase of anti-subsidy investigation widely seen as retaliation for bloc’s EV tariffs China will impose provisional duties of up to 42.7% on certain dairy products imported from the EU from Tuesday after concluding the first phase of an anti-subsidy investigation widely seen as retaliation for the bloc’s electric vehicle tariffs . The tariffs will range from 21.9% to 42.7% – although most companies will pay about 30% – and target products such as milk and cheese, including protected origin brands such as French roquefort and Italian gorgonzola. Continue reading...

events.title: Thailand, Cambodia to discuss truce amid fierce fighting
events.description: The two Asian nations are aiming to revive a ceasefire as deadly clashes continue along their 817-kilometer (508-mile) border.

events.title: Bondi shooters threw unexploded pipe bombs at crowd — police
events.description: The two gunmen threw home-made explosive devices into the crowd at the Bondi beach, but the bombs failed to go off, according to court documents. The father-son duo also practiced with firearms in rural Australia.

events.title: Bus crash in Indonesia kills at least 15 people, official says
events.description: A bus carrying 34 people lost control on a toll road, struck a concrete barrier,

events.title: Ukraine strikes oil terminal, planes and ships in an array of strikes inside Russia
events.description: Ukrainian forces say they have hit an oil terminal, a pipeline, two parked jet fighters, and two ships in a series of strikes on Russian soil

events.title: South Sudan: UN condemns killing of staff member in Wau, calls for swift investigation
events.description: The United Nations on Friday condemned the killing of a civilian staff member serving with its peacekeeping mission in South Sudan (UNMISS), calling on the authorities to swiftly bring those responsible to justice.

events.title: Gaza famine pushed back, but millions still face hunger and malnutrition, UN says
events.description: Food security in Gaza has improved since the ceasefire declared in October, pushing back famine conditions, but the situation remains critical with more than three-quarters of the population still facing acute hunger and malnutrition, a new UN-backed analysis has found.

events.title: Ohio kids as young as 8 steal car, lead police on chase crash into home, worried about Santa, presents: police
events.description: An 11-year-old driving a stolen car led Ohio police on a chase that ended with a crash, with the suspects telling officers they learned to steal cars from YouTube.

events.title: All pupils kidnapped from Nigeria Catholic school now free - officials
events.description: The authorities confirm the remaining students abducted in Niger state last month have been released.

events.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
events.description: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

events.title: Illegal settlement expansion: How Israel is redrawing occupied West Bank
events.description: Israel's approval of 19 new settlements stands to redraw occupied West Bank, undermining prospect of two-state solution.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Another 130 kidnapped schoolchildren released in Nigeria
events.description: Presidential spokesperson says all those abducted from a Catholic school in Niger state last month are now free Nigerian authorities say they have secured the release of a further 130 schoolchildren kidnapped from a Catholic school in November, after 100 were freed earlier this month . “Another 130 abducted Niger state pupils released, none left in captivity,” presidential spokesperson Sunday Dare said on X, in a post accompanied by a photo of smiling children. Continue reading...

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Pilot reports UFO hovering beside jet, leaving air traffic control stunned: 'Good luck with the aliens'
events.description: New video reportedly reveals pilot's eerie encounter with mysterious silver cylinder hovering near aircraft wing over Rhode Island, leaving pilot baffled.

events.title: Leaked University of Illinois lecture material blames Trump for 'White supremacy,' embraces far-left activism
events.description: Leaked slides from University of Illinois education course show left-wing bias on immigration topics, sparking debate over classroom content.

events.title: Mock funeral held for the penny at Lincoln Memorial as 230-year coin production ends
events.description: Mock funeral held at Lincoln Memorial marks end of penny production after President Trump's announcement to halt minting due to rising production costs.

events.title: US Coast Guard pursues third 'dark fleet' oil tanker as Trump targets Venezuelan sanctions evasion network
events.description: President Trump escalates pressure on Venezuela as U.S. Coast Guard pursues sanctioned oil tanker reportedly evading sanctions, A U.S. official tells Fox News.

events.title: Israel calls out UN-backed Gaza famine report as biased, ignores aid flow and on-the-ground data
events.description: Israeli officials slam 'biased' U.N. food security report on Gaza, citing increased aid deliveries. Analysis reveals disputed famine claims lack evidence.

events.title: Texas town battles nonstop noise from bitcoin mine
events.description: A rural Texas community says nonstop noise from a bitcoin mine is destroying their lives.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Cartagena's iconic horse carriages give way to electric buggies
events.description: Cartagena, Colombia, is set to ban its iconic horse-drawn carriages, replacing them with electric buggies — a move dividing the historic city over tradition, tourism, and animal welfare.

events.title: Ecuadorean soldiers jailed for 34 years over boys' forced disappearance
events.description: The four boys were picked up by a military patrol and their bodies were later found mutilated and burned.

events.title: Gold and silver hit records as investors hunt for safety
events.description: Investors are flocking to precious metals amid geopolitical tensions and expectations of more US interest rate cuts.

events.title: Ghana official rejects 'Detty December' label
events.description: The term is widely used to describe Ghana and Nigeria's wild, end-of-year party seasons.

events.title: US pursuing third oil tanker linked to Venezuela, official says
events.description: The move comes days after President Donald Trump said that he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

events.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to meet amid renewed cross-border fighting
events.description: Planned talks come as Southeast Asian leaders urge both countries to show 'maximum restraint' and return to dialogue.

events.title: Boxer Ty Mitchell tells Al Jazeera why he had to confront Tommy Robinson
events.description: Boxer Ty Mitchell told Al Jazeera why he had to confront far-right British activist Tommy Robinson.

events.title: Canada names new ambassador to US as key trade talks loom
events.description: Terms of North American free trade deal set to be renegotiated in 2026 under shadow of US tariff policies.

events.title: Ugandan police tear gas crowd at Bobi Wine campaign event
events.description: Footage shows police dispersing crowds with tear gas at rallies for Ugandan presidential candidate Bobi Wine in Kampala.

events.title: UPS stumbles into holiday season amid shifting trade rules
events.description: After the end of the de minimis rule rewired US import requirements, UPS is struggling to clear shipments.

events.title: Turning Point USA held its AmericaFest conference. Here’s what happened
events.description: Turning Point USA's first AmericaFest without Charlie Kirk reveals ideological rifts within the conservative movement.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: DOJ releases more Epstein files. And, immigration court 'no-shows' surged, NPR finds
events.description: The DOJ has released more files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, NPR finds a rise in the number of immigrants without legal status who aren't showing up to immigration court.

events.title: Scientists say they have discovered 20 new species deep in the Pacific Ocean
events.description: Researchers retrieved reef monitoring devices that had been placed in deep coral reefs in Guam. The devices were placed up to 330 feet below the surface.

events.title: European leaders lock in Ukraine funding amid renewed peace efforts
events.description: The European Union's ambassador to the U.S. argues that Europe's latest financing move strengthens Ukraine's hand at a fragile moment in peace negotiations.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy cautiously optimistic about peace talks
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that while no side is likely to get all of its demands, Kyiv will not accept "some things." Follow DW for the latest.

events.title: UK: Banksy unveils latest mural in London
events.description: Two identical artworks have appeared on the streets of London, at least one of which has been officially claimed by the mysterious artist Banksy. But what is Banksy trying to tell us just days before Christmas?

events.title: Israel: Netanyahu to shut down respected army radio station
events.description: The Israeli government believes that "Galei Tzahal," one of Israel's most popular radio stations, broadcasts "political and divisive content." Opposition figures have criticized proposals to close it down.

events.title: AFCON: A 3,000-kilometer bike ride to catch the opener
events.description: The Africa Cup of Nations is drawing thousands of fans to Morocco, and one chose an unusual way to get there. Moroccan fan Ismail Skira cycled thousands of kilometers from Paris for the opening match.

events.title: Denmark fumes over new US envoy to Greenland
events.description: US President Donald Trump's newly named envoy has said he hopes to help "make Greenland part of the US." Denmark, which controls the autonomous island, is "deeply angered" according to its foreign minister.

events.title: Uncovering the mystery behind colorful aurora skies
events.description: The northern and southern lights, especially active lately, have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: New Zealand, India finalize free trade deal, investment plan
events.description: Wellington and New Delhi aim to double bilateral trade over five years, but New Zealand's government still needs to push the plan past far-right lawmakers in parliament.

events.title: Why Trump is backing Bayer in weedkiller cancer battle
events.description: The Trump administration has diverged from the position of former US President Joe Biden, throwing its weight behind the German chemical giant in its courtroom battle over the pesticide Roundup.

events.title: Malay court denies former PM Najib Razak house arrest
events.description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak has lost a bid to serve the rest of his sentence under house arrest instead of in jail.

events.title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
events.description: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

events.title: Bafana Bafana kick off Africa Cup of Nations with victory against Angola
events.description: South Africa has joined Morocco and become the second team to win their first outing at the Africa Cup of Nations. Lyle Foster helped Bafana Bafana end a six-game winless streak against Angola, curling the ball beyond Hugo Marques’ outstretched arm in the 79th.

events.title: Spectacular late Zambia equaliser spoils Mali's AFCON 2025 debut
events.description: Zambia’s Patson Daka scored in stoppage time to lock in a draw with Mali in their Africa Cup of Nations Group A opener. Mali controlled the match but were punished in the 92nd minute by a spectacular diving header.

events.title: 2025 AFCON: Egypt begins its bid to win tournament with Mohamed Salah
events.description: The 35th Africa Cup of Nations is underway in Morocco. Egypt begins its bid for a record-extending eighth title – and Mohamed Salah’s first – against Zimbabwe in Agadir on Monday. Details by FRANCE 24 journalist Selina Sykes in Casablanca.

events.title: Re-imagining the Christmas Yule log cake: meet Parisian hotel Lutetia's chef
events.description: With Christmas just days away, festive preparations are in full swing for those celebrating. In France, one of the traditions is eating a Christmas log cake, or “bûche de Noel”. On the set, Carys Garland is joined by Nicolas Guercio, the executive pastry chef at Hotel Lutetia in Paris. Discover the history behind the “bûche de Noel” and how, as a chef, Nicolas re-imagines the tradition every year.

events.title: Justice Department restores Trump photo to public database of Epstein files
events.description: ​A photo of U.S. President Donald Trump that had been removed from the ⁠cache of Jeffrey Epstein files released by the Department of Justice was restored on Sunday after officials determined none of Epstein's victims were in the image, the department said. Story by Bryan Quinn and Natalia Odisharia.

events.title: Russian general assassinated - here's why the timing appears significant
events.description: A Russian general being blown up on his own doorstep isn't a good look for Moscow, and it seems it's becoming increasingly common.

events.title: Trump's new Greenland envoy intends to make territory 'a part of the US'
events.description: A new row over the future of Greenland has erupted between Denmark and the US after Donald Trump appointed a special envoy to the territory.

events.title: Is the AI bubble about to burst? If so the consequences could be dire
events.description: The market seems to be content, for now at least, to keep betting big on AI.

events.title: 130 children and staff abducted from Nigerian school last month freed 'in time for Christmas'
events.description: The remaining 130 schoolchildren and staff abducted by gunmen from a Catholic school in Nigeria last month have been freed.

events.title: US in 'active pursuit' of third vessel off Venezuelan coast, officials say
events.description: The US is in "active pursuit" of a third oil tanker near Venezuela in the Caribbean Sea, officials have said.

events.title: Epstein survivor describes 'wilful blindness' around financier
events.description: The earliest publicly known survivor of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse has told Sky News there was a "wilful blindness" about the young women and children around him - as she claimed the US Department of Justice (DoJ) had "broken the law" with the Epstein files.

events.title: 'It's so painful': Shane MacGowan's sister on the struggle to avoid his music
events.description: Siobhan MacGowan almost looks surprised as she remembers.

events.title: Images of Trump among documents reposted to Epstein files release after apparent removal
events.description: Pictures of Donald Trump were included among at least 16 documents that disappeared from the Epstein files released by the Department of Justice (DOJ).

events.title: Prince William brings his son to the same homeless shelter he first visited with Princess Diana
events.description: Prince William and his son, Prince George, have helped make Christmas lunch at a homeless shelter

events.title: France will build a new aircraft carrier as it increases defense spending
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has announced plans to build a new aircraft carrier

events.title: Thousands cheer as the sun rises on winter solstice at Stonehenge
events.description: Thousands of people have gathered at Stonehenge to celebrate the winter solstice

events.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'proceeding constructively'
events.description: The talks are part of the Trump administration’s monthslong push for peace.

events.title: Pope offers gentle critique of Vatican culture in Christmas greeting
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has urged Vatican cardinals to put their ambitions of power and personal interests aside and work instead on building communion

events.title: Saudi Arabia quietly expands access to its only alcohol store for non-Muslim residents
events.description: Saudi Arabia has quietly expanded access to its only alcohol store, now allowing non-Muslim Premium Residency holders to purchase alcohol legally

events.title: Iraq's political future in limbo as factions vie for power
events.description: Political factions in Iraq have been maneuvering since the parliamentary election more than a month ago to form alliances that will shape the next government

events.title: Malaysian court rejects ex-prime minister’s bid to serve remainder of sentence under house arrest
events.description: A Malaysian court has rejected former Prime Minister Najib Razak’s bid to serve the rest of his graft sentence under house arrest

events.title: Synthetic drug market disrupted in Syria after regime change
events.description: Past geopolitical tensions related to the synthetic drug “captagon” are now being mitigated with the Syrian authorities’ commitment to dismantle illicit manufacturing, says the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC).

events.title: Can traditional medicine strengthen modern healthcare? An expert weighs in
events.description: Ginger and cinnamon are more than just ingredients. Along with other spices, their medicinal value is gaining both attention and legitimacy.

events.title: Sudan: Needs rise as people continue to flee fighting in Kordofan
events.description: Families continue to flee intense hostilities across the Kordofan region of Sudan and humanitarian needs are surging, the UN said in an update on Wednesday.

events.title: Two attorneys vanish during Florida fishing trip as 'heartbroken' wife pleads for help finding them
events.description: Two attorneys mysteriously disappeared during Florida fishing trip. Coast Guard found their boat running but empty 70 miles offshore. Search continues.

events.title: Vance explains what the 'America First' movement means and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Iran executes man convicted of spying for Israeli intelligence
events.description: Iran executed a man convicted of spying for Israel's Mossad intelligence agency, accused of conducting over 200 spy missions across multiple cities, including Tehran.
